author: world today news
title: Vienna is sweating! Heatwave brings record number of tropical nights :: wetter.at
text:
This exceeds the long-term average of 15.5 tropical nights for the entire summer months of June, July and August, as UBIMET reports.
The persistent heat, even at night, is hardly surprising in the city center and can be explained by the dense development and the high proportion of asphalt and concrete, which store heat instead of reflecting it. The measuring station on the Hohe Warte also recorded 13 tropical nights in July in which there was hardly any cooling, which leads to unpleasant, sweaty nights.
In Vienna-Döbling, Eisenstadt and St. Pölten, new records were set for tropical nights, with night temperatures not falling below 20 degrees Celsius. The highest temperature was measured on July 10 in Andau at 36.3 degrees.
Strong increase
The trend is clear: the number of tropical nights in Vienna has increased significantly in recent decades. In the 1970s there were about three tropical nights per year, in the 2000s there were already ten to 15, and since the 2010s there have been about 15 to 20 per year. This increase is continuing. Temperatures will temporarily drop slightly, but will remain summery, and the next warming is expected as early as Sunday.

title: Volk Insurance Benefits Engages Expert Colorado Insurance Broker in Loveland and Fort Collins, Colorado | FinancialContent Business Page
text:
Volk Insurance Benefits deserves a special mention for those looking for a Colorado insurance broker in Loveland and Fort Collins, Colorado.

Volk Insurance Benefits is a leading Colorado insurance broker in Loveland and Fort Collins, Colorado , specializing in top-notch employee benefits insurance for businesses and individuals. They offer a variety of services, including:
Their team of experienced agents helps clients navigate the complex world of health insurance, ensuring they have the right coverage at the best price. They provide comprehensive and cost-effective benefits packages for businesses of all sizes, attracting and retaining top talent.
They assist individuals in finding the right plan to meet their needs and budget, whether they are self-employed, unemployed, or dissatisfied with their employer's coverage. They offer a wide range of additional insurance plans, including dental, vision, critical illness, disability, accident, life, and travel insurance.
The team at Volk Insurance Benefits has over 30 years of experience in the industry, making them experts in finding the right insurance solutions for their clients. They are committed to ERISA compliance. They ensure that all employee benefits packages comply with the Employee Retirement Income Security Act (ERISA).
They help clients take advantage of all available Affordable Care Act (ACA) benefits. Their benefits packages offer competitive value, making businesses more attractive to potential hires. Additionally, they work with businesses to create cost-effective benefits packages that align with their budget.
Whether it's a business owner looking to attract top talent or an individual seeking quality health insurance, Volk Insurance Benefits has the experience and expertise to help them find the right solution. With their comprehensive range of services and commitment to client satisfaction, they are a trusted partner for all types of insurance needs.
For more information on individual health insurance in Fort Collins and Greeley, Colorado , visit https://www.volkib.com/individual-health-insurance-fort-collins-loveland-greeley-longmont-windsor-co/ .
Call 970-484-5073 or toll-free at 888-484-5073 for details.

author: Nick Ziegler
title: These New York Yankees Players Could Win Coveted Awards This Season
text:
These New York Yankees Players Could Win Coveted Awards This Season
With spring training wrapping up for the
New York Yankees, the team will be focused on trying to survive a plethora of injuries to begin the year.
This spring has not been kind to the Yankees, with multiple key players expected to miss a significant amount of time.
A strong offseason for New York will be tested with talented players missing time, but there are still plenty of great players on the roster.
With proven All-Stars and players looking to make a name for themselves, the Yankees still might be able to have a strong campaign. However, the pressure will be on some players to step up for New York, and there will be a few who will be eyeing some individual accolades.
Here are a few players to keep an eye on as the season begins who could be up for awards this coming campaign.
Max Fried - AL Cy Young
One of the most important players for New York this season is going to be their newly-signed starting pitcher.
While Fried was initially brought on to be the sidekick to Gerrit Cole, he will now have to be the ace of the staff.
As a two-time All-Star, the southpaw is certainly capable of leading this rotation, and that could result in great things for him. Fried has two top-5 finishes in the National League Cy Young voting with the
Atlanta Braves, with a runner-up finishing coming most recently in 2022.
The talented left-hander has the potential to win this award, but he will have to avoid a slow start after transitioning leagues.
Jasson Dominguez - AL Rookie of the Year
One of the most exciting rookies to watch this season is going to be Dominguez.
As one of the top prospects, not only for the Yankees but in baseball the past few years, the time to prove himself is now.
So far in spring training, there have been some issues playing defense in left field, but he has been hitting the ball well.
Dominguez has the potential to be a five-tool player in the league, and if he shows flashes of that from the start, he could run away with the AL Rookie of the Year Award.
Aaron Judge - AL MVP
As long as Judge is healthy, he is going to be the favorite to win the MVP in the American League.
The talented slugger is coming off arguably the best year of his career in 2024, and is showing no signs of slowing down.
Competition is stiff in the American League for the MVP Award, but this is still Judge’s to lose.
As long as the two-time AL MVP winner can stay on the field, he will be in the running.

author: @abc7
title: 100-year-old World War II veteran becomes oldest usher at Holy Angels Church
text:
ARCADIA, Calif (KABC) -- Joe "Peppy" Sciarra, a proud [World War II](https://abc7.com/tag/world-war-ii/) veteran, is marking a monumental milestone for his 100th birthday.
Surrounded by family and friends, Sciarra celebrated the special day at [Holy Angels Church](https://abc7.com/tag/catholic-church/) in Arcadia. In recognition of his extraordinary service, he received heartfelt honors from both the Vatican and Los Angeles County.
"I venture to say that this is the only 100-year-old in this diocese and probably in the world that is still in active ministry as an usher at this Mass," Holy Angels Church Father Kevin Rettig said.
Related Story: [100-year-old WWII veteran remembers fallen friends on Memorial Day](https://abc7.com/videoClip/memorial-day-world-war-ii-veteran-army/14923620/)
Sciarra's impact extends far beyond this milestone. He continues to inspire, traveling across the nation to share powerful stories of his battles, unexpected leadership and love -- having been married to his wife for over 70 years.
